column1: @entity0 had a pet turtle that he took good care of, everyday.  His turtle's name was @entity1.  @entity1 liked to walk around outside in the garden and dig small holes to sleep in.  @entity0 loved @entity1 and would visit him outside when he got home from school. @entity1's favorite food was oatmeal.  So, every day after school, @entity0 would make @entity1 a big bowl of oatmeal and take it outside for @entity1 to enjoy.  @entity1 would see @entity0 and walk up to him as fast as a turtle can go.  @entity0 would put the bowl down and wait for @entity1 to come up to the bowl to eat from it. When @entity1 reached the bowl, he put his nose on it.  But, the oatmeal was too hot to eat.  @entity0 reached down and blew on the hot oatmeal, to cool it down for @entity1 to eat.  Once the oatmeal was cool enough, @entity1 could dig in and eat his big bowl of oatmeal.  @entity0 loved to watch as @entity1 ate his bowl of oatmeal, because @entity0 took good care of @entity1, everyday.
@placeholder could not @entity1 eat his oatmeal, at first
the oatmeal was too hot to eat
the oatmeal was too hot to eat
he did not like hot oatmeal
it was not his turtle bowl
his nose was too big for the bowl
